title: JavaScript Level 7 â€” Functions & Recursion
concept: Write helper functions and recursive functions in JavaScript.

challenges.title: Distance Between Two Points
challenges.description: Write a helper function distance(x1, y1, x2, y2) that returns the distance between points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2). In main, read four doubles, call the function and print the result.
challenges.inputDescription: Four real numbers x1, y1, x2, y2.
challenges.outputDescription: One real number: distance between the two points.

challenges.title: Power Function (Iterative)
challenges.description: Write a function power(a, n) that returns a^n for integer n (n can be negative, zero, or positive). Use a loop inside the function. In main, read a and n, call power and print the result.

challenges.title: Capitalize Words
challenges.description: Write a function capitalize(sentence) that makes the first letter of each word uppercase. Words are separated by single spaces. In main, read a line, call capitalize, then print the result.
challenges.outputDescription: Same sentence with each word capitalized.
examples:
Input:
hello world from js

Output:
Hello World From Js

challenges.title: Recursive Power (Non-Negative n)
challenges.description: Write a recursive function powerRec(a, n) to compute a^n for n >= 0. In main, read a and n, call powerRec, and print the result.

challenges.title: Recursive Fibonacci
challenges.description: Write a function fib(n) that returns the n-th Fibonacci number using recursion. fib(0)=0, fib(1)=1. Assume n <= 30. In main, read n, print fib(n).

challenges.title: Reverse Sequence Recursively
challenges.description: Given a sequence of integers ending with 0, print all numbers (except the final 0) in reverse order using recursion and without using arrays.
challenges.inputDescription: Integers, one per line, ending with 0.
challenges.outputDescription: Same numbers in reverse order, each on its own line.

challenges.title: Iterative Fibonacci
challenges.description: Write a function fibIter(n) that computes the n-th Fibonacci number using a loop. In main, read n and print fibIter(n).

challenges.title: Count Distinct (Function)
challenges.description: Write a function countDistinct(arr) that returns the number of distinct integers in the array. In main, read n, then n integers into an array, call the function and print the result.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: n. Second line: n integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: number of distinct values.

challenges.title: Max of Array (Function)
challenges.description: Write a function maxArray(arr) that returns the largest element. In main, read n, the elements, and print the maximum.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: n. Second line: n integers.

challenges.title: Contains Element (Function)
challenges.description: Write a function contains(arr, x) that returns true if x appears in the array. In main, read n, the elements, then x, and print YES if found, otherwise NO.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: n. Second line: n integers. Third line: x.
